examSummary.fullName: EUEE Civic and Ethical Education 2007 Grade 12
examSummary.subject: Biology

questionList.questionStatement: When was me Organization of African Union (OAU) transformed into African Union (AU)?
Which African countries joined the League of Nations besides Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Kenya and Tunisia.
questionList.choiceB: Liberia and South Africa.
questionList.choiceC: Algeria and Egypt.
questionList.choiceD: Ghana and Nigeria.

questionList.questionStatement: Who was the leader of the black civil rights' movement killed in April was after addressing his last speech?
questionList.choiceA: Rosa Parks.
questionList.choiceB: Allan John.
questionList.choiceC: Mohandas Gandhi.
questionList.choiceD: Martin Luther King.

questionList.questionStatement: What is meant by treating others the way you want to be treated as well as impartial treatment of people?
questionList.choiceA: Fairness
questionList.choiceB: Truthfulness
questionList.choiceC: Honest
questionList.choiceD: Courage

questionList.questionStatement: When did Ethiopia become the member of the League of Nations?
Which of the following is a peaceful way of settling disputes with the involvement third party?
questionList.choiceA: Arbitration
questionList.choiceB: Negotiation
questionList.choiceC: Mediation
questionList.choiceD: Litigation

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following can best define a democratic constitution?
questionList.choiceA: it give ultimate power to the concerned people.
questionList.choiceB: it establishes different social classes of a given society.
questionList.choiceC: it reflect the psychological and moral values of the society.
questionList.choiceD: it is a legal law subjugated to some other laws of the country.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the Following attributes refers to a person who is ready to listen In others' views?
questionList.choiceA: Civility
questionList.choiceB: Open mindedness
questionList.choiceC: Honest
questionList.choiceD: Civic-mindedness

questionList.questionStatement: Why the Kyoto Protocol is so significant?
questionList.choiceA: Because it is directed at fighting international crimes.
questionList.choiceB: Because it is adopted to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
questionList.choiceC: Because its main agenda on equitable use of international rives.
questionList.choiceD: Because it is made to find solutions for refugees throughout the the world.

questionList.questionStatement: Which right is different from the others?
questionList.choiceA: Right to Life
questionList.choiceB: Right to Liberty
questionList.choiceC: The right to the security of persons.
questionList.choiceD: The right to assembly and demonstration.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following peoples' movement was the first to join the Tigray Peoples' Liberation Front to create the Ethiopian Peoples' Revolutionary, Democratic Front.
questionList.choiceA: The Oromo Peoples' Democratic Movement.
questionList.choiceB: The Ethiopian Peoples' Democratic Movement.
questionList.choiceC: The South Nations ,Nationalities, and peoples' Movement.
questionList.choiceD: The Ethiopian Democratic Officers' Revolutionary Movement.

questionList.questionStatement: Where did Ethiopia play a role in peace keeping mission?
questionList.choiceA: Angola
questionList.choiceB: Congo
questionList.choiceC: North Korea.
questionList.choiceD: South Africa.

questionList.questionStatement: It is underscored that the chance of the vulnerability of women to HIV/AIDS twenty times compared to men. What is the main reason for this problem?
questionList.choiceA: This is because women are exposed for abduction.
questionList.choiceB: This is because women usually use sharp iron tools compared to men.
questionList.choiceC: This is because women have easily vulnerable tissues during sexual intercourse.
questionList.choiceD: This is because women are naturally weaker and easily exposed for any diseases.

questionList.questionStatement: Which strategy is devised to achieve the development of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: The tourism sector must develop first and then the industrial sector.
questionList.choiceB: Both the agricultural and the industrial sectors must develop together
questionList.choiceC: The agricultural sector must develop first followed by the industrial sector.
questionList.choiceD: The industrial sector must develop first followed by the agricultural sector.

questionList.questionStatement: What form of democracy has recently been adopted by the Ethiopian Government?
questionList.choiceA: Neo-liberalism.
questionList.choiceB: Social democracy.
questionList.choiceC: Liberal democracy.
questionList.choiceD: Developmental democracy.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the correct constitutional name for one of the member states in the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: The Afar Regional State.
questionList.choiceB: The Afar National State.
questionList.choiceC: The Afar Regional National State.
questionList.choiceD: The Afar National Regional State.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is the best manifestation of corruption?
questionList.choiceA: Dowry.
questionList.choiceB: Cheap labor.
questionList.choiceC: Nepotism.
questionList.choiceD: Holiday banquet.

questionList.questionStatement: What types of rights are exclusively reserved only to citizens in a state?
questionList.choiceA: Civil rights.
questionList.choiceB: Moral rights.
questionList.choiceC: Human rights.
questionList.choiceD: Political rights.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following refers to a kind of a person who is unwilling to understand the qualities of other cultures and considering his or her own culture as superior to others?
questionList.choiceA: Civic-minded
questionList.choiceB: Ethnocentric
questionList.choiceC: Tolerant
questionList.choiceD: Open minded

questionList.questionStatement: Who used the crowned Lion of Judah as the emblem of the Ethiopian flag during his reign?
questionList.choiceA: Haileselasaie I.
questionList.choiceB: Menelik II.
questionList.choiceC: Tekle-Giorgis.
questionList.choiceD: Yohannes IV.

questionList.questionStatement: Why is constitutionalism valued as a fundamental constitutional principle? Because it
questionList.choiceA: makes citizens subservient to government.
questionList.choiceB: enables a government to exercise its will over the people.
questionList.choiceC: binds the government to act in accordance with constitution.
questionList.choiceD: allows government to exercise extra-constitutional authorities.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following can best explain a legitimate government?
questionList.choiceA: It safeguards the right of interest groups.
questionList.choiceB: It fails to uphold transparency and accountability.
questionList.choiceC: It can function beyond the limit of the constitution.
questionList.choiceD: It receives its mandate or governing from the people.

questionList.questionStatement: What kind of party system is currently followed by Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Single Party system.
questionList.choiceB: Two Dominant Party Systems.
questionList.choiceC: Multi-Party system.
questionList.choiceD: One Dominant Party.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about Ethiopian languages as stipulated in the constitution of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia.
questionList.choiceA: Amharic shall be state language of the country.
questionList.choiceB: Amharic shall be the working language of member states.
questionList.choiceC: Regional States can have their own respective working language.
questionList.choiceD: All Ethiopian languages shall be recognized based on the size of their speakers.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the current Ethiopian court system?
questionList.choiceA: The empowerment of judges who are directed by the law.
questionList.choiceB: The existence of a judiciary system that is controlled by the government.
questionList.choiceC: The absence of recognition to traditional courts operating based on religious principles.
questionList.choiceD: The absence of the recognition to tradition courts operating based on unwritten laws.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is put in correct order of sequence regarding scientific method of research?
questionList.choiceA: Data Collection --- Hypothesis --- Analysis --- Evaluation of Results --- Conclusion.
questionList.choiceB: Analysis --- Evaluation of Results --- Data Collection --- Hypothesis --- Conclusion.
questionList.choiceC: Hypothesis --- Data Collection --- Analysis --- Evaluation of Results --- Conclusion.
questionList.choiceD: Analysis --- Hypothesis --- Data Collection --- Conclusion --- Evaluation of Results.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the Millennium Goals of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Federating Ethiopia with Djibuti.
questionList.choiceB: Finding solution for Sudan-South Sudan civil war.
questionList.choiceC: Decreasing the death of mother's and child on birth.
questionList.choiceD: Making the Horn of Africa free from any war and conflict.

questionList.questionStatement: What form of government best represents the commonness of extra-constitutional power by those who assume state power?
questionList.choiceA: Aristocracy.
questionList.choiceB: Democracy.
questionList.choiceC: Oligarchy
questionList.choiceD: Dictatorship.

questionList.questionStatement: Which government body is responsible for appointment judges of the Federal Courts of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: The Head of the State.
questionList.choiceB: The Council of Ministers.
questionList.choiceC: The President of the supreme Court.
questionList.choiceD: The House of Peoples Representatives.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the conduct and accountability of the Government as stipulated in Article 12 of the Current Ethiopian Constitution?
questionList.choiceA: The conduct of affairs of the government shall be secretive.
questionList.choiceB: The government shall defend the failure of public officials.
questionList.choiceC: An elected representative has the right to access national secret.
questionList.choiceD: In case of loss of confidence, the people have the right to recall an elected representative

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following approaches has a direct role in preventing corruption?
questionList.choiceA: Ethical regulations.
questionList.choiceB: Registration of properties of citizens.
questionList.choiceC: Laws related to financial administration and auditing systems.
questionList.choiceD: The emergence of groups interested in accumulating wealth at others' expense.

questionList.questionStatement: How and when can the current Ethiopian Constitution be amended?
questionList.choiceA: When two-thirds of the country's population votes to approve the proposed amendment.
questionList.choiceB: When the Prime Minister and the president agrees to approve the proposed amendment.
questionList.choiceC: When the Regional State Administration and State Councils jointly approve a proposed amendment by a majority.
questionList.choiceD: When the House of Peoples' Representatives and the House of the federation in a joint session, approve a proposed amendment by a two thirds majority.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following statements can best describe the federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Ordinary laws at the Federal level are made by the parliament
questionList.choiceB: At the Federal level, the higher executive powers are given to Parliament.
questionList.choiceC: Ordinary laws at the Regional level are made by the state Administration.
questionList.choiceD: At the Regional level the State Council is the highest organ of executive power.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following best expresses the concept of arbitration as a way of conflict resolution?
questionList.choiceA: It in an proceeding by a party in parties against another in a court of law.
questionList.choiceB: It is a means of applying legal principles to s controversy for final solution.
questionList.choiceC: It involves direct discussion between or among the parties to reach an agreement.
questionList.choiceD: Is a method of non-binding dispute resolution involving a neutral third putty.

questionList.questionStatement: What basic principle is underlined in due process of law?
questionList.choiceA: An accused person has the right to be represented by a legal counsel.
questionList.choiceB: An accused person can be considered guilty as soon as he/she comes under control.
questionList.choiceC: Supporting unequal accessibility of court and tribunals to any person committee crime.
questionList.choiceD: An accused person suspected for matters no national security has the right to a quick public trial.

questionList.questionStatement: What makes the Presidential Democratic system different from the parliamentary one?
questionList.choiceA: The President is elected from the winning party.
questionList.choiceB: Once elected, the President has unlimited power.
questionList.choiceC: The President heads the executive branch of the government.
questionList.choiceD: The check and balance between the three branch of government

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about a federal state structure?
questionList.choiceA: It is conducive he too small Shiites.
questionList.choiceB: it is suitable for multi-ethnic society.
questionList.choiceC: It is characterized by centrally controlled power.
questionList.choiceD: It is impossible organize units based on natural boundaries.

questionList.questionStatement: What constitutional rights are given to the regional states of the FDRE?
questionList.choiceA: The right to have their own anthem as a symbol of their state.
questionList.choiceB: The right to recruit and train their own defence force to keep security.
questionList.choiceC: The right to formulate and establish their own external relations.
questionList.choiceD: The power to control the Supreme Court of the central government.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the objective of the Ethiopian foreign policy?
questionList.choiceA: Promoting relation with states standing for religious fanatic.
questionList.choiceB: Respecting conventions which challenge Ethiopia's interest.
questionList.choiceC: Establishing a geographically defined relations with some countries.
questionList.choiceD: Creating economic and cultural ties with countries supporting Ethiopia's enemy.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about Ordinary Laws?
questionList.choiceA: They are above the Constitution.
questionList.choiceB: They are enacted through a proclamation.
questionList.choiceC: They can contradict with the Constitution.
questionList.choiceD: They are made by B Constituent Assembly.

questionList.questionStatement: What does habeas corpus refer to?
questionList.choiceA: An accused person has the right to it quick public trial.
questionList.choiceB: A person shall not be accused again for a single crime already treated.
questionList.choiceC: A self- incriminating person has no burden to prove his or her innocence.
questionList.choiceD: A person arrested by a police man has the right to know why he or she is arrested.

questionList.questionStatement: What does state sovereignty imply?
questionList.choiceA: Superiority of one state over the other.
questionList.choiceB: Non-interaction among sovereign states.
questionList.choiceC: Non-intervention in the domestic affairs of states.
questionList.choiceD: Unquestionabiliy of domestic rules and decisions.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following can be describe parliamentary structure of government?
questionList.choiceA: The head of the government is the president.
questionList.choiceB: The role of the head of the government is ceremonial.
questionList.choiceC: The prime minister is elected by popular vote of citizens.
questionList.choiceD: The head of the government is responsible to the legislature.

questionList.questionStatement: What does the phrase justice delayed is justice denied express?
questionList.choiceA: It express that justice coming late is unacceptable.
questionList.choiceB: It emphasizes the right to be tired with out undue delay.
questionList.choiceC: The need to reject possible appeal time to higher court.
questionList.choiceD: The need to disapprove the time spent before the trial begins

questionList.questionStatement: In democracy society a good citizenship is the active side of one's character. Which of the following statements best reflects the message of the phrase in the quotation mark?
questionList.choiceA: One must apply the principles of citizenship in his or her conduct.
questionList.choiceB: The character of good citizenship cannot be acquired through learning.
questionList.choiceC: Theoretical knowledge is the science aspect of good citizen ship.
questionList.choiceD: Good citizenship is an art to be practice through civic commitment.

questionList.questionStatement: What is correct regarding deliberate transmission of HIV/AIDS?
questionList.choiceA: It is considered as a suicide.
questionList.choiceB: It can be taken as a serious crime of homicide.
questionList.choiceC: It can be seen as part of the HIV/AIDS victims' attempt to share his/her pain.
questionList.choiceD: It can be taken as part of the HIV/AIDS patient's effort exploit his/her rights and duties.

questionList.questionStatement: What is meant by morality?
questionList.choiceA: It is a way of behaving according to legal laws.
questionList.choiceB: It is system that tells a person to act against nature.
questionList.choiceC: It is principles which are similar throughout the world.
questionList.choiceD: It is a standard examining the rightness and wrongness of our acts.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is an expected duty of a patriot citizen?
questionList.choiceA: Sacrificing personal interest for the common good.
questionList.choiceB: Giving access state's secret to neighbouring countries.
questionList.choiceC: Avoiding of criticizing government polices based on evidence.
questionList.choiceD: Keep away from taking part in voluntary activities so as to save time.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following sentence is correct about co-operation and competition among nations?
questionList.choiceA: Co-operation crops up tension resulting from competition for resource.
questionList.choiceB: Countries co-operate to protect and reserve their natural and cultural heritages.
questionList.choiceC: Co-operation between two nations lasts along when it is based on unequal benefits.
questionList.choiceD: Countries co-operate for inequitable use of natural resources, such as cross-boundary Rivers.

questionList.questionStatement: Which principle of the Hippocratic Oath is currently recognized in Ethiopia ?
questionList.choiceA: Giving priority to patients who are elder
questionList.choiceB: Assisting patients and keeping their secret
questionList.choiceC: Insulting fellow physicians when they make error on job
questionList.choiceD: Providing assistance to patients who prefer to commit suicide.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the features of federal form of states, such as Ethiopia ?
questionList.choiceA: The power of the central government is indivisible.
questionList.choiceB: The regional governments are supreme in their own spheres.
questionList.choiceC: The power of the regional government is given by the national government.
questionList.choiceD: The existence of the local units depends on the willingness of the central government.

questionList.questionStatement: How can the concept of negotiation be best explained as a way of conflict resolution?
questionList.choiceA: It is a proceeding by a party or parties against another in a court of law.
questionList.choiceB: It is a means of applying legal principles to a controversy for final solution.
questionList.choiceC: Is a method of non-binding dispute resolution involving a neutral third party.
questionList.choiceD: It involves direct discussion between or among the parties to reach an agreement.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the principle of the constitution of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia in relation to religion ?
questionList.choiceA: There shall be state religion.
questionList.choiceB: state and religion are inseparable.
questionList.choiceC: All religions of the land are equal in status.
questionList.choiceD: Government shall intervene in the affairs of religion.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following statements is correct about rule of Law?
questionList.choiceA: Rule of Law is natural law acquired by virtue of being human.
questionList.choiceB: To practice rule of law, government must be the source of power.
questionList.choiceC: The existence of constitutionalism guarantees the prevalence of rule of law.
questionList.choiceD: The main major purpose of rule of law is to limit popular sovereignty.

questionList.questionStatement: When does the Ethiopian government apply legal limitation on the right to freedom of expression?
questionList.choiceA: When a citizen criticizes against the government.
questionList.choiceB: When a citizen propagates in support of an opposition party.
questionList.choiceC: When a citizens makes propaganda with out the knowledge of the government.
questionList.choiceD: When a citizen makes a propaganda harming the honor and reputation of individuals.

questionList.questionStatement: What does referendum refer to?
questionList.choiceA: A power referred to a government to give final decision on some problems.
questionList.choiceB: The veto power given to the chief executive to decide on some political matters.
questionList.choiceC: The direct participation of people in giving decision on some political matters.
questionList.choiceD: The direct participation of peoples' representatives in the politics of a country.

questionList.questionStatement: Which specific right of any accused person is violated if the trial goes with an unintentional absence of the accused?
questionList.choiceA: The right to a fair and public hearing.
questionList.choiceB: The right to be tried with out undue delay.
questionList.choiceC: The right to a fair trial in his or her presence.
questionList.choiceD: The right to have free assistance of an interpreter.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is the best recommendation for person who for the first time made HIV/AIDS blood test and informed that he is not victim?
questionList.choiceA: To be sure he should be retested.
questionList.choiceB: He should be abstained from having sex.
questionList.choiceC: As he is sure that he is not victim he should marry a wife.
questionList.choiceD: Since he is sure that he is not victim he should continue his past habits.

questionList.questionStatement: Which the following powers and functions belongs In the Regional Governments of Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Formulation of foreign policy.
questionList.choiceB: Declaring stale of emergency in the country
questionList.choiceC: Negotiating and ratifying international agreements.
questionList.choiceD: Formulating policy on land use and natural resources.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the purpose of learning Civic education in academic institution of Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: To forge active participation in support the ruling party.
questionList.choiceB: To produce a personality of passive consent in the action of others.
questionList.choiceC: To effect the personality of just any kind of civic participation or a subject people.
questionList.choiceD: To effect the personality of civic participation of informed and responsible citizens.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following does not develop the habit of saving among individuals.
questionList.choiceA: The act of spending money wisely.
questionList.choiceB: Balancing the needs and wants of individuals.
questionList.choiceC: Thinking and planning about the me of our features.
questionList.choiceD: The encouragement of extravagance behaviour of individuals.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about saving in relation to locally produced items.
questionList.choiceA: Wastage of a lot inputs harms a development of a country.
questionList.choiceB: Avoiding wastage during production is one means of saving money.
questionList.choiceC: Buying locally produced items help to save money when they are cheaper.
questionList.choiceD: Wastage of inputs is the main cause for decreasing cost of production.

questionList.questionStatement: In which form form of government is the removal of chief executive through the process of None-Vote of confidence?
questionList.choiceA: Presidential.
questionList.choiceB: Parliamentary.
questionList.choiceC: Semi-Presidential.
questionList.choiceD: Quasi-Presidential.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following qualities is expected from a person to be a patriotic citizen?
questionList.choiceA: The person should not be law abiding.
questionList.choiceB: The person should not be loyal to his her country.
questionList.choiceC: The person should work for his or her parochial interest.
questionList.choiceD: The person should be self-evident and defend his or her constitutional rights.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the personal qualities of a good leader?
questionList.choiceA: A one who falls pray to their own doing.
questionList.choiceB: A one who is aware of how much he does not know.
questionList.choiceC: A one who has ability to influence others without logic.
questionList.choiceD: A one who rationalises unethical behaviour based upon current needs.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following statements is correct about group rights in the current Ethiopian context?
questionList.choiceA: They are not treated as universal rights.
questionList.choiceB: They are made to eliminate rights belonging to an individual.
questionList.choiceC: They are made to favour the disadvantaged groups at others expense.
questionList.choiceD: They are made to facilitate the realization of discrimination among peoples of the State.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following statement goes with the principle of equality within diversity?
questionList.choiceA: Equality with diversity erodes national unity.
questionList.choiceB: Ethnocentrism promotes equality within diversity.
questionList.choiceC: Equality with diversity is an obstacle for national development.
questionList.choiceD: All citizens are equal before the law regardless of cultural backgrounds.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the characteristics of undemocratic government 7
questionList.choiceA: It believes in accountability to empower people.
questionList.choiceB: I does not give recognition to talented people.
questionList.choiceC: It believes that government is the source of unquestionable.
questionList.choiceD: It believes that legitimate power resides in the people and government

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about corruption?
questionList.choiceA: it reduces public confidence in the government.
questionList.choiceB: All acts of corruption results in the payment of bribes.
questionList.choiceC: Civil servants commit corruption in 3 more systematic way than government officials.
questionList.choiceD: The fight against corruption can be successful through preventive action: than curative measures.

questionList.questionStatement: What is true about ethics?
questionList.choiceA: Ethics is the same as feelings.
questionList.choiceB: Ethics is the same as religion.
questionList.choiceC: Ethics means strictly following the law.
questionList.choiceD: Ethics is following and doing culturally accepted norms and practices.

questionList.questionStatement: In the context of economic globalization, what efforts have been made by Ethiopian government to promote foreign direct investment?
questionList.choiceA: The provision of land without lease.
questionList.choiceB: To let investors remit part of their country.
questionList.choiceC: The decline to give a tax holiday for foreign direct investors.
questionList.choiceD: The provision of limited information on the possible profitable ventures.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following factors is responsible for promoting job satisfaction?
questionList.choiceA: Lack of interest in the work.
questionList.choiceB: Career growth through short term training.
questionList.choiceC: Long hours of work and low financial.
questionList.choiceD: Insecurity of work and unhealthy working conditions.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the possible threat to international peace and security?
questionList.choiceA: Afforestation.
questionList.choiceB: Increasing price of oil.
questionList.choiceC: Increasing desertification.
questionList.choiceD: Growing arms race between nations.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the possible benefit that one can get from fulfilling his/her responsibility?
questionList.choiceA: The inability to exploit his/her rights.
questionList.choiceB: Lack of confidence and self-accomplishment.
questionList.choiceC: The development of a sense of dependence upon others.
questionList.choiceD: The achievement of being valued by the concerned society.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about citizens combating challenges of international magnitude that affects humanity?
questionList.choiceA: Being unaware of politics and current affairs.
questionList.choiceB: Disinclination to work together in tackling problems.
questionList.choiceC: Acquiring knowledge and the skills as per the global reality.
questionList.choiceD: unwilling to co-operate with the world to eliminate the problem.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the role of the judiciary organ in the current Ethiopia context?
questionList.choiceA: Drafting the constitution when it is required.
questionList.choiceB: Restoring justice whenever the law is violated.
questionList.choiceC: Encouraging controversies in order to resolve them.
questionList.choiceD: Defending biased court officials and self-centred lawyers.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following ideas refers to an attempt to exterminate clan, family or people?
questionList.choiceA: Genocide.
questionList.choiceB: Drug trafficking.
questionList.choiceC: Aggression.
questionList.choiceD: Corruption.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is considered as a criminal offence inrelation to taxation?
questionList.choiceA: Having license for your shop.
questionList.choiceB: Unwillingness to reveal the appropriate income.
questionList.choiceC: An attorney in a court for a person committed a crime.
questionList.choiceD: Assisting custom officials in an effort In combat contraband trade.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the Ethiopian flag?
questionList.choiceA: It is in recent fabrication.
questionList.choiceB: It serves as symbol of unity.
questionList.choiceC: It is a purely colonial legacy.
questionList.choiceD: It has insignificant historical value.

questionList.questionStatement: which of the following is correct about Drug use and trafficking?
questionList.choiceA: Drug users cannot stop taking drugs.
questionList.choiceB: Drug users involve in robbery and then.
questionList.choiceC: Drug users are highly respected among their society.
questionList.choiceD: Drug users are committed to fight illegal weapon trafficking.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following statements is correct about the principle of rule if law?
questionList.choiceA: All laws have equal power.
questionList.choiceB: Every citizen is subject to the law.
questionList.choiceC: No a law is superior to mother law.
questionList.choiceD: Laws are monopolized by a government.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about human rights?
questionList.choiceA: They are acquired after birth.
questionList.choiceB: They are created and maintained by states.
questionList.choiceC: They are natural and enjoyed by all human kind.
questionList.choiceD: They are exercised based on one's political achievement.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is an obligation of n citizen as per the constitution of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopian?
questionList.choiceA: Valuing gender disparity.
questionList.choiceB: Respecting the government as the source of power.
questionList.choiceC: Respecting the constitution as the supreme law of the land.
questionList.choiceD: Fighting for and upholding the inequality of groups and individuals.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the primary justification for adopting the federal system in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: To avoid tyrannical rule from the center.
questionList.choiceB: To suppress local initiatives and interests across the state.
questionList.choiceC: To accommodate all the centrifugal forces within one nation.
questionList.choiceD: To look for ways or having greater weight against external force.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following ideas agrees with the principle of multiculturalism?
questionList.choiceA: It undermines peoples to promote their Cultural distinctions.
questionList.choiceB: It believes that the prevalence of diversity is an obstacle for unity.
questionList.choiceC: It believes that no culture is superior or inferior to any other culture.
questionList.choiceD: It underscores that the very purpose of politics is to affirm group indifferences.

questionList.questionStatement: What benefit can be gained from utilizing locally produced goods than the exported ones in a country?
questionList.choiceA: Promoting imbalance import-export trade.
questionList.choiceB: Proper and efficient exploitation of resources.
questionList.choiceC: Keeping country's domestic factories out of business.
questionList.choiceD: Alienation of a given country from an international trade.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is Correct about a good leader?
questionList.choiceA: He/she strives to attain persona] gains.
questionList.choiceB: He/she creates vision and inspires others to achieve goals.
questionList.choiceC: He/she depends on threats and coercion to meet his/her goals.
questionList.choiceD: He/she sets a plan to keep his/her position and struggles to achieve it.

questionList.questionStatement: which one or the following can best describe the personal quality of a versatile leader?
questionList.choiceA: The quality of being flexible, resourceful and an all rounded one.
questionList.choiceB: The quality of realizing what is achievable based on known facts.
questionList.choiceC: The quality or inspiring others and committing to the objective of the task.
questionList.choiceD: The presence of good ability to set appropriate courses of action through plan.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the advantage of citizens' participation in making and evaluating public policies?
questionList.choiceA: It develops a sense of betrayal among citizens.
questionList.choiceB: it promotes suspicion between government and citizens.
questionList.choiceC: It enables citizens to formulate and implement sustainable and effective policies.
questionList.choiceD: It enables government to know the feeling and reactions of citizens towards Various issues.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about the role played by governmental and non-governmental organizations in promoting citizens participation in policy making?
questionList.choiceA: They raise awareness of the community.
questionList.choiceB: They organize venue for expressing views.
questionList.choiceC: They arrange and facilitate discussions to identify local problems.
questionList.choiceD: They arrange debates which promote unsubstantiated judgement of policies.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is the reason for adopting the principle of equality for the current Ethiopian society?
questionList.choiceA: To encourage gender discrepancy.
questionList.choiceB: To eradicate citizens' economic inequality.
questionList.choiceC: To enable the society to have a similar culture.
questionList.choiceD: To develop the different cultures of the country.

questionList.questionStatement: What is the consequence of corruption in a country?
questionList.choiceA: It eliminates societal moral values.
questionList.choiceB: It increases foreign direct investment.
questionList.choiceC: It reduces expenditure for public services.
questionList.choiceD: It reduces investment and the rate of growth.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following goes with the notion of constitutional patriotism in the current Ethiopian context?
questionList.choiceA: Citizens' commitment to the state's development.
questionList.choiceB: Citizens' commitment to conquer neighbouring countries.
questionList.choiceC: Citizens' indulgence to cultural and religious fundamentalism.
questionList.choiceD: Citizens' determination to fight the virtue of tolerance in the state.

questionList.questionStatement: What is true about cultural relativism?
questionList.choiceA: Societal norms form tire basis of morality.
questionList.choiceB: Morality does not differ front culture to culture.
questionList.choiceC: The moral values of one culture can be judged to be better than that of the other.
questionList.choiceD: There are universally agreed moral principles by which we judge our action.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following Contributes for creating favourable Condition for corruption?
questionList.choiceA: The presence of measurement of corruption.
questionList.choiceB: The emergence of rent-seeking political elites.
questionList.choiceC: The devotion of the government to apply harsh penalties.
questionList.choiceD: Citizens' unreserved commitment For combating corrupted officials.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following statements agrees with the principle of fairness?
questionList.choiceA: Everybody should benefit according to his/her age.
questionList.choiceB: It is unfair to consider ageism when sharing benefits.
questionList.choiceC: Benefits should be distributed as per burdens discharged.
questionList.choiceD: Benefits should be shared regardless one's responsibilities.

questionList.questionStatement: What can be an outcome of fair distribution of benefits and burdens among citizen of a state?
questionList.choiceA: The cultivation of the sense of 'weness' among citizens.
questionList.choiceB: The elimination of economically and socially stratified groups.
questionList.choiceC: The development of citizens' subordination to the government.
questionList.choiceD: The cultivation of shared feeling towards international politics.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is an indicator of poverty in a country.
questionList.choiceA: Low illiteracy rate.
questionList.choiceB: Low infant mortality rate
questionList.choiceC: Very low population size.
questionList.choiceD: Low average life expectancy.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is an attribute of patriotism?
questionList.choiceA: Developing rent-seeking behaviour.
questionList.choiceB: Playing the role of whistle blowers.
questionList.choiceC: Recognizing and accepting cultural indifferences.
questionList.choiceD: Respecting heritages on the basis of ethno-centrism.

questionList.questionStatement: What can be a consequence of economic dependency of developing nations?
questionList.choiceA: The development of self sustained economy of developing nations.
questionList.choiceB: The increment of the stagnation of the economies of developed nations.
questionList.choiceC: The emerging of balanced economic relationship between the developed and developing nations.
questionList.choiceD: The occurrence of technological and financial penetration by the developed nations at the expense of the developing ones.;
